ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Very good, broad, covered a wide variety of cancer, physiology and epidemiology.
This is a great class which I will recommend to other students

I enjoyed the variety of different cancer types that were covered in the course and the practical aspect of looking through data on cancer statistics. I think there were some redundancy in some of the lectures, and that time could have been spent on a better understanding of analytical tools for cancer epidemiology
Nice exposure to various cancers/cancer-related topics

Strengths in providing introductory content regarding cancer, but not as great a focus on the epidemiology. A little disorganized, syllabus could be strengthened. The lectures can be a bit dry sometimes.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  She is very nice.
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Dr. Cartmel is very thoughtful of this class. She is sensitive to students' feedback and willing to discuss this class material.
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Her lecture was easy to understand, and other lecturers were also great.
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Brenda is extremely nice and a pleasure to work with, her lectures can be somewhat dry sometimes though.

Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Dr. Cartmel is an excellent teacher. Although I am student without prior training in public health or epidemiology, she readily accepted me in her class and went out of her way to ensure that I understood the course material.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Very useful to those interested in cancer epidemiology.
For someone without any background on epidemiology, it's a really good course. I learned a lot. Yes, I would.
Great introduction to multiple cancers and easy to understand even though you're not from medical field.
If you are interested in cancer, then I recommend taking the course; otherwise, it may be boring.
